## Install Gnome Extensions

children.html: HOME/Downloads/gnome−extensions.zip−dHOME/Downloads/gnome-extensions.zip -d HOME/Downloads/gnome−extensions.zip−d

children.value:
## Install GTK theme

Create directory .themes on your home directory
extract orchis gtk theme mode gtk-themes.zip into $home/.themes

children.html: HOME/Downloads/GTK−Themes.zip−dHOME/Downloads/GTK-Themes.zip -d HOME/Downloads/GTK−Themes.zip−d

children.value: This is Orchis GTk theme wich several part of the them have been modified

children.html: HOME/.themes/Orchis−Dark/gtk−4.0/assets,gtk.css,gtk−dark.cssHOME/.themes/Orchis-Dark/gtk-4.0/{assets,gtk.css,gtk-dark.css} HOME/.themes/Orchis−Dark/gtk−4.0/assets,gtk.css,gtk−dark.css

children.value:
## Install Icon Theme

mkdir -p $HOME/.local/share/icons


unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/icon-themes.zip -d $HOME/.local/share/icons


## Install Cursors theme


mkdir -p $HOME/.icons

unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/cursors-theme.zip -d $HOME/.icons

## Install Fonts

unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/fonts.zip -d $HOME/.local/share/

### Install wallpapers

sudo unzip -o ~/Downloads/wallpapers.zip -d /usr/share/backgrounds/

## Install Conky Widget

sudo apt install conky-all jq curl playerctl -y

### Install conky config

cd ~/Downloads

unzip -o ~/Downloads/conky-config.zip -d $HOME/.config

## Install  Cava

### 

sudo apt install cava -y

unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/cava-config.zip -d $HOME/.config/

## Install Neofetch

sudo apt install neofetch -y


unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/neofetch-config.zip -d $HOME/.config/

## Install Fish Shell and oh my posh

Inst

sudo apt install fish -y 

chsh -s /usr/bin/fish


### Install

sudo wget https://github.com/JanDeDobbeleer/oh-my-posh/releases/latest/download/posh-linux-amd64 -O /usr/local/bin/oh-my-posh

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/oh-my-posh

### Insall fish shell

unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/fishomp-config.zip -d $HOME

chmod u+rw ~/.poshthemes/*.json

## flatpak

sudo apt install gnome-software gnome-software-plugin-flatpak flatpak libfuse2 -y


flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub \https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo

### apps flatpack

flatpak install flathub io.bassi.Amberol -y

flatpak install flathub net.agalwood.Matrix -y

flatpak install flathub 

flatpak install flathub

flatpak install flathub

### Enable Orchis  GTX

sudo flatpak override --filesystem=$HOME/.themes 

sudo flatpak override --filesystem=$HOME/.local/share/icons 

sudo flatpak override --filesystem=xdg-config/gtk-4.0

### install gnome apps

sudo apt install gnome-weather \
gnome-maps \
gnome-audio \
gnome-calendar \
gnome-clocks \
gnome-connections \
gnome-console \
gnome-contacts \
gnome-music \
vlc \
gnome-shell-pomodoro -y

## Install plymouth theme
sudo apt install plymouth -y

sudo unzip -o $HOME/Downloads/plymouth-theme.zip -d /usr/share/plymouth/themes

sudo update-alternatives --install \/usr/share/plymouth/themes/default.plymouth default.plymouth \/usr/share/plymouth/themes/hexagon_dots/hexagon_dots.plymouth 100




sudo update-alternatives --config default.plymouth

press 2 

sudo update-initramfs -u

### apply gnome shell settings

unzip $HOME/Downloads/ubuntu-desktop-settings.zip -d $HOME/Downloads/

dconf load / < $HOME/Downloads/ubuntu-desktop-settings.conf 

### Romve Snap Apps and Service 

cp -afv $HOME/snap $HOME/Downloads/

snap list

sudo snap remove --purge firefox

sudo snap remove --purge gnome-42-2204

sudo snap remove --purge gtk-common-themes

sudo snap remove --purge bare

Publish MyST Book on GitHub Pages

children.label: Publish MyST Book on GitHub Pages

children.value: Follow these steps to publish your MyST book to GitHub Pages and make it publicly accessible:
First, build the static site files:
and create a new repository (public or private).
Do not add a README, .gitignore, or license (to avoid merge conflicts).
3. Initialize git and push your site

children.label: 3. Initialize git and push your site

children.value:
git init
git commit -m "first commit"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/Rone-Nem0/25_2.git
git push -u origin main

git add . 
git commit -m "Upload: New information"
git push

children.label: 4. Upload the site to the gh-pages branch

children.value: tool to upload the built site:
This will push the contents of
Go to your repository settings on GitHub.
After a few minutes, your site will be available at:

You can automate this with GitHub Actions for continuous deployment.
